summary.Title: Project Lead, DK - Esbjerg
summary.Presentation: Do you enjoy coordinating and planning and do you want to work in an expanding international company?Then we have the perfect opportunity for you! We are looking for a talented and ex

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you enjoy coordinating and planning and do you want to work in an expanding international company?
Then we have the perfect opportunity for you! We are looking for a talented and experienced project lead to join us on our journey.

Your position
You will be joining our Access and Coating team within the Transitional Energies division. This team specializes in providing services related to fabric maintenance, rope access/scaffolding, electrical, rigging, and mechanical work.

We are committed to delivering high-quality operations through a team of qualified and experienced professionals, handling a diverse range of repair tasks both onshore, offshore, and internationally.

The position is based in Esbjerg on a full-time, permanent basis at the Semco Maritime headquarters. As such, local residency is preferred.

Your tasks & responsibilities
You will be a key asset to our Access and Coating group, taking on a leadership role in project operations. This includes overseeing all responsibilities and tasks related to the initiation and completion of projects.

Your tasks will include but are not limited to:

  • Planning, preparation, and execution of a wide variety of jobs on oil & gas, industrial plants and wind farm structures.
  • Planning and coordinating tasks for onshore and offshore related jobs in the energy industry related to:
  • Personnel selection
  • Equipment selection and packing
  • Preparation of work packages
  • Execution and ensuring project progress in timely manner.
  • Project completion including closing documentation.
  • Risk analysis and control systems
  • Communication with teams


Your profile & qualifications
We are looking for an experienced professional with extensive experience form the offshore industry. You must be well versed in the daily activities of Offshore Fabric Maintenance.
It is important that you are driven by seeing the results of your work and that you are a great team-player who is also able to work independently.

To succeed in this position, we imagine that you:

  • Have experience with offshore projects
  • Have good planning and coordination skills
  • Have mechanical experience (coating or E&I would be a plus)
  • Have strong communication skills
  • Are fluent in English, verbal and written.
  • Are comfortable and enjoy working with people from multiple different cultural backgrounds.


Welcome to Semco Maritime
At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,200 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?
Change. With us.
Apply via the link:
https://semcomaritime.career.emply.com/ad/project-lead/3vou7n/en

Semco Maritime is an international engineering and contracting company dedicated to projects in the energy sector. For 40 years, we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. From turnkey engineering solutions to outsourcing of manpower and delivery of components, systems and solutions – we make sure our customers and partners in the energy sector experience safe and cost-efficient solutions. Semco Maritime has approx. 1,900 employees and branches in Denmark, Norway, United Kingdom, Germany, Singapore and the US. For further information, please see www.semcomaritime.com.
